title: Charlotte Church and mum open up about 'brutal' rift that left family broken

Charlotte Church and her mum Maria have opened up about their "brutal" rift which left their family heartbroken.

The singer, 33, recently revealed that she had mended things with her mum and stepfather after a bitter rift which spanned years.

Charlotte walked out of the family home when she was a teenager to move in with her boyfriend, who was jobless at the time.

In a new Channel 4 documentary, the family bare their souls as they discuss their long-run spat for the first time as Charlotte spends a week with mum Maria and stepdad James in Devon.

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

Speaking on This Morning, Maria said that she found it incredibly difficult to deal with her daughter being estranged.

Charlotte began by telling hosts Holly Willoughby and Phillip Schofield that their family was under a lot of pressure for various reasons, including a kidnap plot.

She said: "My mum and dad were dealing with a lot - there was a couple of kidnap plots when I was a kid, so it was on a lot of different levels.

"A whole lot of stress and pressure and we were living in each other's pockets."

(Image: ITV)

Asked whether it led to them being estranged, Maria said: "It was, for a while, when Charlotte left home. It just just very, very brutal and very sudden.

"She broke my heart - I ended up having a nervous breakdown."

Confirming that she was back in therapy now, she said it was "going really well".

She added: "At least I'm trying to do something about it now because I've always suffered with mental health issues. Mine are quite complex because there's a mixture of everything, it's a bag of worms.

"We're getting there."

*This Morning airs weekdays at 10.30am on ITV
description: Singer Charlotte, 33, appeared on This Morning with mum Maria and spoke about their bitter rift which spanned years
